name: NYC Local Law 144
description: New York City Local Law 144 compliance framework for automated employment decision tools (AEDTs) requiring bias audits and candidate notifications.

framework.name: NYC Local Law 144 - Automated Employment Decision Tools
framework.description: NYC Local Law 144, effective July 5, 2023, regulates the use of automated employment decision tools (AEDTs) in hiring and promotion decisions. It requires employers and employment agencies to conduct annual bias audits, publicly disclose audit results, and notify candidates when AEDTs are used. This framework helps organizations comply with these requirements.

structure.title: 1. AEDT Identification and Scope
structure.description: Identify automated employment decision tools subject to Local Law 144 and determine applicability.

items.title: 1.1 AEDT Definition Compliance
items.description: Determine if tools meet the legal definition of an automated employment decision tool.
items.summary: Identify tools that qualify as AEDTs
questions: Does the tool use machine learning, statistical modeling, data analytics, or AI?
Does the tool substantially assist or replace discretionary decision-making in employment?
Is the tool used for screening candidates for employment?
Is the tool used for screening employees for promotion?

items.title: 1.2 Covered Employment Decisions
items.description: Identify employment decisions where AEDTs are used.
items.summary: Document AEDT use in employment decisions
questions: Is the AEDT used in hiring decisions for positions in NYC?
Is the AEDT used in promotion decisions for employees in NYC?
Are all covered positions and roles identified?
Is the scope of AEDT use documented?

items.title: 1.3 Employer/Agency Determination
items.description: Determine responsibilities as employer or employment agency.
questions: Is the organization an employer using AEDTs for NYC positions?
Is the organization an employment agency using AEDTs?
Are third-party AEDT providers identified?
Are compliance responsibilities clearly assigned?

structure.title: 2. Bias Audit Requirements
structure.description: Conduct required annual bias audits of AEDTs by independent auditors.

items.title: 2.1 Independent Auditor Selection
items.description: Select an independent auditor to conduct the bias audit.
questions: Is the auditor independent from the organization and AEDT developer?
Does the auditor have no material interest in the audit outcome?
Are the auditor's qualifications documented?
Is there a signed engagement agreement?

items.title: 2.2 Bias Audit Timing
items.description: Ensure bias audits are conducted within required timeframes.
questions: Was a bias audit completed within one year before AEDT use?
Is there a schedule for annual bias audits?
Are audit completion dates documented?
Is there a process to track audit currency?

items.title: 2.3 Impact Ratio Calculation
items.description: Calculate required impact ratios for sex and race/ethnicity categories.
questions: Are impact ratios calculated for selection/scoring by sex category?
Are impact ratios calculated for selection/scoring by race/ethnicity category?
Are impact ratios calculated for intersectional categories (sex and race/ethnicity)?
Is the calculation methodology documented and compliant?

items.title: 2.4 Historical Data Analysis
items.description: Use appropriate historical data for bias audit calculations.
questions: Is historical data from the employer's own use of the AEDT available?
If not, is data provided by the AEDT developer used appropriately?
Is the data set sufficiently large for statistical validity?
Are data limitations documented?

items.title: 2.5 Audit Report Requirements
items.description: Ensure bias audit reports contain all required elements.
questions: Does the report include the date of the audit?
Does the report include the source and explanation of data used?
Does the report include the number of individuals assessed?
Does the report include all required impact ratios?

structure.title: 3. Public Disclosure Requirements
structure.description: Publish required bias audit information on the organization's website.

items.title: 3.1 Summary of Results Publication
items.description: Publish a summary of the most recent bias audit results.
questions: Is a summary of bias audit results published on the website?
Does the summary include the distribution date of the AEDT?
Does the summary include the source and explanation of data?
Does the summary include the number of individuals assessed?

items.title: 3.2 Impact Ratio Disclosure
items.description: Disclose all calculated impact ratios publicly.
questions: Are impact ratios for sex categories published?
Are impact ratios for race/ethnicity categories published?
Are intersectional impact ratios published?
Are the ratios presented clearly and accessibly?

items.title: 3.3 Website Accessibility
items.description: Ensure disclosed information is accessible on the careers or jobs section.
questions: Is the information posted on the careers or jobs section of the website?
Is the information easy to find for candidates?
Is the information available for at least 6 months after AEDT use?
Can the information be accessed without barriers?

structure.title: 4. Candidate Notice Requirements
structure.description: Provide required notices to candidates and employees about AEDT use.

items.title: 4.1 Notice Timing
items.description: Provide notice at least 10 business days before AEDT use.
questions: Is notice provided at least 10 business days before AEDT use?
Is there a system to track notice delivery timing?
Are timing requirements met for all candidates?
Is proof of notice timing maintained?

items.title: 4.2 Notice Content - AEDT Use
items.description: Notify candidates that an AEDT will be used.
questions: Does the notice state that an AEDT will be used?
Does the notice describe the job qualifications assessed by the AEDT?
Does the notice describe the characteristics the AEDT evaluates?
Is the notice clear and understandable?

items.title: 4.3 Notice Content - Data Collection
items.description: Disclose data collection and retention practices.
questions: Does the notice explain what data will be collected?
Does the notice explain what data will be analyzed?
Does the notice describe data sources?
Does the notice explain data retention practices?

items.title: 4.4 Alternative Process Information
items.description: Inform candidates of alternative selection processes.
questions: Are candidates informed of available alternative processes?
Is a reasonable alternative to AEDT evaluation offered?
Are instructions for requesting alternatives provided?
Is the alternative process genuinely available?

items.title: 4.5 Notice Delivery Methods
items.description: Use appropriate methods to deliver required notices.
questions: Is notice provided in the job posting (for external candidates)?
Is written notice provided to internal candidates?
Is notice provided by mail or email when required?
Are delivery methods documented?

structure.title: 5. Data Privacy and Retention
structure.description: Manage candidate data collected and processed by AEDTs appropriately.

items.title: 5.1 Data Collection Minimization
items.description: Collect only data necessary for AEDT assessment.
items.summary: Limit data collection to necessary information
questions: Is data collection limited to what is necessary for assessment?
Are unnecessary data fields identified and eliminated?
Is the purpose of each data element documented?
Is there a process to review data necessity?

items.title: 5.2 Demographic Data Handling
items.description: Handle demographic data appropriately for bias audits.
questions: Is demographic data collected only for bias audit purposes?
Is demographic data protected from use in employment decisions?
Are appropriate safeguards in place for sensitive data?
Is demographic data handled in compliance with privacy laws?

items.title: 5.3 Data Retention
items.description: Retain AEDT-related data for required periods.
questions: Is bias audit data retained appropriately?
Are notice delivery records maintained?
Is there a data retention schedule for AEDT data?
Is data disposed of securely when no longer needed?

structure.title: 6. Vendor and Third-Party Management
structure.description: Manage AEDT vendors and ensure their compliance.

items.title: 6.1 Vendor Compliance Requirements
items.description: Ensure AEDT vendors support compliance requirements.
questions: Do vendor contracts include bias audit support provisions?
Can vendors provide data needed for bias audits?
Do vendors provide documentation of AEDT functionality?
Are vendor compliance obligations clearly defined?

items.title: 6.2 Vendor Due Diligence
items.description: Conduct due diligence on AEDT vendors.
questions: Is vendor due diligence conducted before AEDT adoption?
Are vendor bias audit capabilities assessed?
Is vendor data handling reviewed?
Are vendor compliance certifications obtained?

items.title: 6.3 Ongoing Vendor Monitoring
items.description: Monitor vendor compliance on an ongoing basis.
questions: Is vendor compliance monitored regularly?
Are vendor changes to AEDTs communicated and assessed?
Is there a process to address vendor compliance issues?
Are vendor audits or assessments conducted periodically?

structure.title: 7. Governance and Documentation
structure.description: Establish governance structures and maintain documentation for compliance.

items.title: 7.1 Compliance Ownership
items.description: Assign clear ownership for Local Law 144 compliance.
questions: Is there a designated owner for Local Law 144 compliance?
Are roles and responsibilities clearly defined?
Is compliance integrated into HR and hiring processes?
Is there executive oversight of compliance?

items.title: 7.2 Policy and Procedures
items.description: Establish policies and procedures for AEDT compliance.
questions: Is there a policy governing AEDT use and compliance?
Are procedures documented for all compliance requirements?
Are policies reviewed and updated regularly?
Are employees trained on policies and procedures?

items.title: 7.3 Record Keeping
items.description: Maintain records to demonstrate compliance.
questions: Are bias audit reports and supporting data retained?
Are notice delivery records maintained?
Is there an audit trail for compliance activities?
Are records organized and easily retrievable?

items.title: 7.4 Compliance Monitoring
items.description: Monitor and assess ongoing compliance.
questions: Is there ongoing monitoring of compliance status?
Are compliance gaps identified and addressed?
Is there a process for handling complaints or inquiries?
Are compliance metrics tracked and reported?
